FuncDef:
The cusp agent command configures a CUSP connection as a control channel between a forwarder and controller and displays the CUSP forwarder view.
The undo cusp agent command deletes the CUSP connection configuration as well as all configurations in the CUSP forwarder view.
By default, no CUSP connection is configured for a control channel.

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies the name of a CUSP agent.
The value is a string of 1 to 31 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
In a CU separation scenario, the controller and forwarders communicate through control channels. The control channels can be established using various protocols. Currently, the VRP uses the CUSP protocol to establish the control channels. To configure a CUSP connection as a control channel between a forwarder and controller, run the cusp agent command.
This command is delivered by the vBRAS-CP to the vBRAS-UP.
Follow-up Procedure
Run the transport-address command to configure a local IP address for the CUSP connection.
Precautions
This command is supported only on the admin VS.
If the undo cusp agent command is run, all configurations in the CUSP forwarder view are deleted.
